Dear Lauryn Ritchie:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
05/22/2025. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
427 East Alcott St.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• No Technical Assistance was requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No Consultation was requested or required.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit and letter from their auditor.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator documented not having to write any corrective action plans
throughout this reporting period. She also documented there is a plan to open the
facility within a year. The plan is to enter into a Juvenile Justice contract, serving
the youth identified as Juvenile Justice youth. The facility will remain a 6-bed
program. It is documented that currently the facility building serves as a resource
building for employee development, virtual schooling, emergency shelter, gaming,
and various other youth activities and engagements. It is also documented the
facility has had no unannounced discharges
Staff and Youth Interviews
Three administration staff were interviewed. They reported a belief that the program
will be up and running with Juvenile Justice youth within this next year. They also
reported working on a program that will provide services that meet a Juvenile
Justice contact and the needs of the youth. All were very positive about this
upcoming program. They reported their primary concern is finding appropriate and
skilled staff for the program.
The agency does not have youth.
3

Description of Agency Walk Through
This is an older two-story facility in a residential neighborhood close to the campus
of Western Michigan University. The facility is older and receiving regular
maintenance and repairs as needed. All plumbing is in working order and the
facility is furnished appropriately. The facility is being updated with newer
furnishings as they prepare to open the program.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
6/3/2025

Paul Fatato Date
